article.headline: LIU Brooklyn 63, Sacred Heart 60
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- James Williams scored 14 points to help Long Island University snap a three-game losing streak with a 63-60 victory over Sacred Heart on Thursday. Sacred Heart jumped out to a 7-0 lead on a layup by Tavio Hobson, but LIU (5-11, 2-5 Northeast Conference) went on a 17-9. The Blackbirds took an 18-16 advantage on a free throw by Randy Jones at 7:01 and led 26-25 at halftime. Jarrid Frye led the Pioneers (9-10, 6-4) with a game-high 16 points. Kibwe Trim had 14 points and 10 rebounds. LIU scored the first five points of the second half to take a 31-25 lead at 18:54. Williams finished the run with a jumper. Sacred Heart responded with a 10-2 surge, capped by Trim's layup at 14:52, to take a 35-33 lead. The Blackbirds used a 23-10 run to take the lead for good and go up 56-45 with 6:12 left. Williams again finished the run, this time with a 3-pointer.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
